error.signature: ERROR: No buildpack groups passed detection. Please check that you are running against the correct path.

verdict.summary: Cloud Native Buildpacks (pack, Heroku, Cloud Foundry) cannot detect the application type. The detection phase examines files like package.json, requirements.txt, go.mod, etc. Failure means no buildpack in the group matched the application structure.

dead_ends.action: Adding multiple conflicting language files to trick detection
dead_ends.why_fails: Multiple detection matches can cause ambiguous buildpack ordering or selection of the wrong buildpack, leading to build failures later in the process

dead_ends.action: Specifying a buildpack URL without verifying it supports the app type
dead_ends.why_fails: An incompatible buildpack will fail at the build phase instead of detection, producing more confusing errors

workarounds.action: Ensure the correct project files exist in the root directory
workarounds.how: For Node.js: ensure package.json is in the root. For Python: add requirements.txt or setup.py. For Go: add go.mod. For Java: add pom.xml or build.gradle. Check that the build path points to the correct directory.

workarounds.action: Explicitly specify the buildpack to use
workarounds.how: Use pack build --buildpack <buildpack-uri> or add a project.toml file with [[build.buildpacks]] entries to explicitly select the buildpack instead of relying on auto-detection.

leads_to.condition: when buildpack failures lead teams to switch to Dockerfile-based builds

preceded_by.condition: when checkout failure results in an incomplete source tree missing detection files

frequently_confused_with.distinction: buildpack-detect-failed is specific to Cloud Native Buildpacks auto-detection; docker-build-failed is a Dockerfile-based build error
